recipes.title: Valache Dhapate (Field Bean Flatbread)
ingredients: Soaked, skinned vaal beans – 1/2 cup (roughly crushed)
procedure: Mix Jowar, Wheat and Besan flours with vaal, onion, coriander, chilies, garlic, cumin, sesame, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Add water gradually to form a soft dough; knead with 1–2 tsp oil and rest 10–15 mins.
Oil a banana leaf or plastic; pat a lemon-sized dough ball into a 5–6 inch round (medium thickness).
Roast on a medium-hot tawa; flip when spots appear. Drizzle oil/ghee; cook both sides.
Repeat for all; keep covered to stay soft.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve hot with white butter/ghee and dry garlic chutney or pickle; tea or curd on the side.
recipes.context_tips: Hearty farm breakfast from coastal Palghar; hand‑patting gives rustic texture. Keep medium thickness so insides cook before outsides char.

recipes.title: Tandalache Ghavan (Rice Crepes)
ingredients: Optional: pinch cumin; spoonful of yogurt
procedure: Whisk rice flour and salt with water to a very thin, lump‑free batter; rest 5–10 mins.
Heat a greased tawa on medium; keep batter stirred (it settles).
Pour a ladle, swirl to spread lace‑thin. Cover 15–20 sec; cook one side only.
Slide off carefully; repeat.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with coconut chutney, dry fish chutney, or sweetened coconut milk; also pairs with fish curry.
recipes.context_tips: Unlike dosa, ghavan needs no fermentation; some families add a splash of palm toddy for lightness.

recipes.title: Amboli (Fermented Rice–Urad Pancake)
procedure: Soak rice, urad, and fenugreek 4–6 hrs; add poha later; grind smooth to thick batter.
Salt and ferment overnight till airy (toddy was traditional; pinch of yeast acceptable).
Pour for a 6–7 inch pancake; do not spread thin. Cover and cook; flip once to finish.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve hot with fish curries or with butter and chutney at breakfast.
recipes.context_tips: A mild tang is ideal. Fermentation time varies with weather along the coast.

recipes.title: Kanda Pohe (Onion Poha)
ingredients: Garnish: grated coconut, coriander, lemon wedges
procedure: Rinse poha briefly; drain. Toss in turmeric, sugar, and salt.
Heat oil; splutter mustard and cumin. Fry peanuts; add curry leaves and chilies.
Add onions; sauté to translucent‑golden.
Fold in poha on low heat 2–3 mins. Moisten with a sprinkle of water if dry.
Finish with lemon; garnish with coconut and coriander.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve warm with lemon. Classic coastal tea‑time or breakfast dish.
recipes.context_tips: Use thick poha; avoid over‑soaking. A dash of local vinegar is a regional twist.

recipes.title: Nachani Pej / Ambil (Ragi Porridge Drink)
procedure: Whisk ragi flour with 1 cup water; add remaining water with garlic and chili.
Cook on medium, stirring till glossy and raw smell fades (5–7 mins).
Cool to lukewarm; for ambil, ferment overnight for a slight tang.
Add buttermilk and salt (savory) OR dissolve jaggery and cardamom (sweet).
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve cool in hot weather; garnish with cumin/cilantro if savory.
recipes.context_tips: Constant stirring prevents lumps; fermentation improves digestibility.

recipes.title: Goad Ghavan (Sweet Jaggery Crepe)
ingredients: Rice flour – 1½ cups (or 1 cup rice + 1/2 cup semolina)
procedure: Combine dry items; add jaggery, banana, coconut, cardamom, and salt.
Whisk in liquid to dosa‑like batter; rest 10 mins.
Cook 5–6 inch crepes on medium‑low with ghee; flip once to golden.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve warm as‑is or with a dab of ghee or cream.
recipes.context_tips: Slightly thicker than plain ghavan for the best texture.

recipes.title: Sabudana Khichdi (Sago Pilaf)
ingredients: Salt (sendha namak for fasts) – to taste
procedure: Rinse and soak sabudana 4–5 hrs with just‑covering water; drain well.
Toss pearls with peanut powder, salt, and sugar.
Heat ghee; temper cumin (and curry leaves). Cook potato till tender.
Add sabudana mix; toss on medium‑low till pearly and translucent (~5–6 mins).
Finish with lemon; garnish.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve hot; classic breakfast or fasting dish.
recipes.context_tips: Coat pearls with peanut to reduce clumping; avoid over‑stirring.

recipes.title: Bharlela Paplet (Stuffed Pomfret in Banana Leaf)
ingredients: Inaagre (palm/cane vinegar) – 2 tbsp (or 1 tbsp tamarind / juice of 1 lemon)
procedure: Score and season fish with salt, turmeric, and a little vinegar.
Grind coconut, chilies, garlic, ginger, coriander, cumin, turmeric, salt with vinegar to a thick paste.
Stuff cavity and side slits. Rest 15–20 mins.
Wrap each fish in banana leaf parcel; secure and pan‑roast covered on medium, turning once or twice, till fish flakes.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Unwrap at table; serve with lemon and onion; pairs with rice or ghavan.
recipes.context_tips: Leaf‑wrapped patravali cooking keeps fish moist and aromatic; mortar‑pestle yields a superior texture.

recipes.title: Tandalachi Bhakri (Rice Flatbread)
procedure: Scald rice flour with boiling salted water; mix to form hot dough.
Knead warm till smooth; keep covered. Divide and hand‑pat discs ~6 inch, 1/3 cm thick.
Cook on hot tawa; flip; press edges; optional brief direct flame for puff.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve hot with curries, thecha, or butter + jaggery; great with fish gravies.
recipes.context_tips: Keep dough warm and covered; moisture retention is key to softness.

recipes.title: Varan–Bhaat (Plain Dal with Steamed Rice)
ingredients: Tadka: Ghee – 2 tsp; Mustard – 1/2 tsp; Cumin – 1/2 tsp; Curry leaves – 5–6; Garlic – 3 cloves, slivered; Green chili – 1 (optional)
procedure: Pressure cook dal with water, turmeric, and hing till creamy; mash.
Salt and optional jaggery; simmer to medium‑thick.
Make tadka in ghee and pour over; cook rice separately and serve dal over rice with ghee.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with pickle/papad; first course in many meals.
recipes.context_tips: Golden (not burnt) garlic gives sweetness; adjust thickness with hot water.

recipes.title: Vaalache Birdhe (Field Bean Coconut Curry)
ingredients: Tempering: Oil – 2 tbsp; Mustard – 1/2 tsp; Cumin – 1/2 tsp; Hing – pinch; Curry leaves – few
procedure: Boil/pressure‑cook sprouted vaal till tender; drain.
Blend coconut with water to a fine paste. Temper oil with mustard, cumin, hing, curry leaves; add turmeric and chili powder.
Add vaal, coconut paste, and water to thin; simmer. Season with goda masala, tamarind, salt (and jaggery if using); simmer till balanced.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice or bhakri; soothing, classic curry.
recipes.context_tips: Sprouting reduces bitterness; peel translucent skins for the best texture.

recipes.title: Teprat (Goat Trotters & Bottle Gourd Wedding Curry)
ingredients: Inaagre (palm/cane vinegar) – 1/4 cup (or 3 tbsp cider vinegar)
Teprat masala (roasted): Coriander 2 tbsp, Cumin 2 tsp, Fennel 1 tsp, Black pepper 1 tsp, Cloves 5, Cinnamon 1", Dry red chilies 5–6, pinch nutmeg
procedure: Blanch cleaned trotters 5 mins with a pinch turmeric; drain.
Fry onions to golden; add ginger–garlic; then turmeric and chili powder.
Add trotters; roast 5–7 mins. Add ground teprat masala; roast till oil separates.
Add hot water and salt; cover and slow‑simmer ~2 hours.
Add bottle gourd; cook till tender. Finish with vinegar; simmer 10 mins and balance seasoning.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice or vade; include marrow pieces in each bowl; onion–lemon salad on side.
recipes.context_tips: Slow fire yields gelatin‑rich broth. Inaagre is milder and slightly sweet—distinct from synthetic vinegar.

recipes.title: Bombil Fry (Crispy Bombay Duck)
procedure: Pat bombil dry. Marinate with turmeric, chili, garlic, lemon, salt for 10–15 mins.
Mix rice flour and rava; dredge fillets to coat both sides evenly.
Shallow fry on medium heat till crisp-golden; turn gently once.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve immediately with lemon wedges and onion rings; pairs with solkadhi or rice.
recipes.context_tips: Bombil holds water—pat very dry for best crispness; flour+rava gives durable crunch.

recipes.title: Bombil Kalwan (Bombay Duck Curry)
procedure: Grind coconut with coriander, cumin, red chilies, garlic, ginger to a fine paste.
Heat oil; sauté onions to golden; add tomato till soft.
Add masala and turmeric; roast till aromatic and oil separates.
Add water to curry consistency; slide in bombil and kokum; simmer 6–8 mins; salt to taste.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with steamed rice or tandalachi bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Do not overcook bombil; add fish after gravy boils.

recipes.title: Kalva Kalwan (Clam Curry)
procedure: Grind coconut with coriander, cumin, chilies, garlic, ginger to a smooth paste.
Sauté onion in oil till light brown; add turmeric and coconut paste; roast.
Add water; bring to boil; add clams; cook till they open.
Season with tamarind and salt; simmer briefly.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice or ghavan.
recipes.context_tips: Discard unopened clams; avoid overcooking to keep tender.

recipes.title: Sukkat Javla Chi Bhaji (Dry Shrimp Stir-fry)
procedure: Rinse javla quickly; squeeze dry.
Heat oil; sauté garlic till pale; add onion, chilies, curry leaves.
Add javla and turmeric; stir-fry on medium-high 4–5 mins.
Finish with coconut and lemon.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri or as a side to rice meal.
recipes.context_tips: Quick wash only—long soaking dulls flavor.

recipes.title: Kolim Chi Chutney (Dried Shrimp Chutney)
procedure: Dry-roast shrimp lightly; cool.
Pound with dry coconut, garlic, chili, tamarind, jaggery, and salt to coarse chutney.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with oil-sprinkled bhakri and onion.
recipes.context_tips: Pounding (not fine grinding) gives authentic texture.

recipes.title: Paplet Saar (Pomfret Curry)
procedure: Grind coconut with chilies, garlic, ginger to smooth paste.
Sauté onion in oil; add turmeric and masala; roast briefly.
Add water to thin; bring to boil; add fish and kokum; simmer gently till fish cooks.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with steamed rice.
recipes.context_tips: Add fish only after gravy boils; do not over-stir.

recipes.title: Sukka Bangda Ambat (Dry Mackerel Curry)
procedure: Grind coconut-coriander-cumin-chilies-garlic to paste.
Sauté onion and tomato; add paste and turmeric; roast.
Add water; bring to boil; add soaked mackerel and tamarind; simmer till flavors meld.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice and onion salad.
recipes.context_tips: Rinse dried fish well to control salinity.

recipes.title: Kolambi Bhaat (Prawn Pulao)
procedure: Marinate prawns with turmeric, chili, salt 10 mins.
Heat oil/ghee; fry whole spices and onion to golden; add ginger-garlic, tomato.
Add prawns; sauté briefly.
Add soaked rice, salt, coconut milk + water to 4 cups total; cook covered till rice is done.
Rest 10 mins; fluff and garnish.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with lemon and salad.
recipes.context_tips: Avoid overcooking prawns; add briefly before simmering rice.

recipes.title: Kombdi Kalwan (Chicken Curry)
ingredients: Vadvali/East-Indian masala – 2 tbsp (or garam masala + chili)
procedure: Roast coconut to light brown; grind with water.
Brown onions in oil; add ginger-garlic; then turmeric and masala; roast.
Add chicken and salt; bhunao 6–8 mins.
Add coconut paste and water; simmer covered till tender.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with vade or rice bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Country chicken needs longer simmer; adjust water accordingly.

recipes.title: Mutton Rassa (Goat Curry)
procedure: Roast coconut and spices; grind fine.
Brown onions well; add ginger-garlic; then turmeric and ground masala.
Add mutton and salt; roast till sealed.
Add water; cover and simmer till tender (pressure cook if preferred).
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice or bhakri; onion-lemon on side.
recipes.context_tips: Slow simmer deepens flavor; rest curry 15 mins before serving.

recipes.title: Dalimbi Usal (Hyacinth Bean Sprout Curry)
ingredients: Dried val (dalimbi) – 2 cups, soaked, sprouted, peeled
procedure: Pressure-cook sprouted beans till tender.
Temper oil with mustard/cumin (optional); sauté onion and tomato.
Add spices and cooked beans; adjust water; simmer 5–7 mins.
Balance with jaggery and tamarind; finish with coriander.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice or bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Peel skins for creamy texture; kadve-vaal has inherent bitterness—balance carefully.

recipes.title: Surna Chi Kaalvan (Yam & Black Peas Curry)
procedure: Pressure-cook black peas till tender; parboil yam with turmeric and salt.
Grind coconut-coriander-cumin-garlic-chilies to paste.
Sauté onion; add paste; roast; add peas, yam, tamarind, water; simmer to desired thickness.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice; drizzle ghee if desired.
recipes.context_tips: Handle yam carefully; use lemon/vinegar on hands to reduce itch.

recipes.title: Valpapdi & Vangi Bhaji (Field Bean + Brinjal)
procedure: Heat oil; temper mustard and cumin; add garlic and onion; sauté.
Add papdi and brinjal; season with turmeric, chili, salt; cook covered till tender; stir occasionally.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Do not overcook brinjal—retain shape.

recipes.title: Chana–Kobi–Batata Bhaji
procedure: Temper mustard & cumin in oil; add garlic and onion; sauté.
Add potatoes; cook half-way.
Add cabbage and chickpeas; season; cook till tender-crisp.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with chapati/bhakri; squeeze lemon before serving.
recipes.context_tips: Keep cabbage slightly crisp for texture.

recipes.title: Masale Bhaat (Spiced Rice)
procedure: Heat ghee; temper mustard, cumin, curry leaves; add chilies.
Add vegetables; sauté briefly.
Stir in washed rice, turmeric, goda masala, salt; add water (per rice) and cook covered till done.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with curd and pickle.
recipes.context_tips: Do not over-stir after rice blooms; rest 10 mins before fluffing.

recipes.title: Limbache Lonche (Lemon Pickle)
ingredients: Mustard seeds – 2 tsp, lightly roasted & powdered
procedure: Mix lemon quarters with salt and turmeric; jar and sun for 3–4 days.
Add chili, methi and mustard powders; heat oil to smoking, cool slightly, pour over; mix and store.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with meals, especially plain dal-chawal.
recipes.context_tips: Use clean, dry jars; oil layer prevents spoilage.

recipes.title: Kairi Cha Loncha (Raw Mango Pickle)
procedure: Salt and turmeric the mango; rest 30 mins; drain moisture slightly.
Mix chili, roasted methi & mustard powders; temper oil with hing; cool and mix into mango; bottle.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve as a side with bhakri and poha.
recipes.context_tips: Ensure mango is very firm; avoid water contact.

recipes.title: Kolimache Lonche (Tiny Shrimp Pickle)
procedure: Heat oil; lightly fry garlic; cool.
Mix shrimp with chili, turmeric, salt, vinegar; add cooled oil-garlic; bottle.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Roast shrimp lightly first to remove raw aroma.

recipes.title: Shengdana–Lasun Chutney
procedure: Grind peanuts, garlic, chili, salt to coarse powder.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri and ghee.
recipes.context_tips: Do not overgrind; coarse texture is ideal.

recipes.title: Jawas Chutney (Flaxseed Powder)
procedure: Dry-roast flaxseeds; cool; pulse with garlic, chili, and salt.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with oil-sprinkled bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Grind briefly to avoid gumminess.

recipes.title: Methkut (Roasted Grain–Dal Powder)
procedure: Dry-roast each ingredient separately; cool; grind to fine powder; salt to taste.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve over hot rice with ghee.
recipes.context_tips: Roast on low to avoid bitterness; cool fully before grinding.

recipes.title: Muramba (Fruit Preserve, e.g., Amla)
procedure: Make sugar syrup to one-thread; add amla; cook on low till translucent and syrupy; finish with cardamom.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with farsan or as tonic.
recipes.context_tips: Sterilize jars; syrup should cover fruit fully.

recipes.title: Mirchi cha Thecha (Green Chili Crush)
procedure: Pound chilies, garlic (and peanuts) coarsely; mix salt and oil.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri and curd.
recipes.context_tips: Pounding releases juices; do not puree.

recipes.title: Sukka Bombil Thecha (Dry Fish Chili Crush)
procedure: Pound roasted bombil with chilies and garlic; season with salt and lemon.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri and onions.
recipes.context_tips: Roast bombil to brittle before pounding.

recipes.title: Chinch–Gulachi Karmel (Tamarind–Jaggery Spread)
procedure: Cook tamarind and jaggery to a glossy, spreadable consistency; finish with ghee and cardamom.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve on ghavan or as chutney.
recipes.context_tips: Balance sweet–tart; store refrigerated.

recipes.title: Shevla Chi Bhaji (Dragon-stalk Yam)
procedure: Rinse and prep shevla; blanch briefly to reduce astringency.
Sauté onion and garlic; add shevla, spices, salt; cook covered till tender.
Finish with grated coconut.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Use gloves if sensitive; blanching tames itch.

recipes.title: Alambi Rassa (Wild Mushroom Curry)
procedure: Grind coconut-coriander-cumin-garlic-chilies to paste.
Brown onions; add paste; roast till aromatic.
Add mushrooms and water; simmer 8–10 mins; season.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with rice or bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Clean wild mushrooms thoroughly; avoid overcooking.

recipes.title: Fanasachi Bhaji (Raw Jackfruit)
procedure: Oil hands and knife; cube jackfruit; pressure cook 1–2 whistles.
Sauté onion and garlic; add spices, then jackfruit; stir-fry.
Moisten as needed; finish with goda masala.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with chapati/bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Oil prevents sap sticking; avoid overcooking.

recipes.title: Takla Chi Bhaji (Cassia Tora Greens)
procedure: Sauté onion and garlic; add greens; cook till wilted; season with spices and salt.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with bhakri or rice.
recipes.context_tips: Slight bitterness is characteristic; balance with chili and garlic.

recipes.title: Solkadhi (Kokum–Coconut Digestif)
procedure: Soak kokum in warm water 15–20 mins; squeeze to extract.
Blend coconut milk with kokum extract, chili, garlic (optional), cumin, and salt; strain.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve chilled with seafood meals.
recipes.context_tips: Do not boil; color turns dull. Adjust tartness with kokum.

recipes.title: Naralachi Kheer (Tender Coconut Pudding)
procedure: Simmer milk with sugar/jaggery to slightly thick; cool to warm; stir in coconut water and meat; add cardamom; chill.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve chilled on Sharad Purnima nights.
recipes.context_tips: Avoid boiling after adding tender coconut—curdles.

recipes.title: Ukhana (Warm Jowar Beverage)
procedure: Whisk jowar in water lump-free; cook, stirring till glossy; sweeten with jaggery and finish with ghee & cardamom.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve warm in winters and weddings.
recipes.context_tips: Constant stirring prevents lumps.

recipes.title: Ukadiche Modak (Steamed Rice Modak)
ingredients: Filling: Fresh coconut – 2 cups; Jaggery – 1.5 cups; Cardamom – 1/2 tsp; Nutmeg – pinch
procedure: Cook filling: melt jaggery with coconut till moist and glossy; add cardamom.
Boil water with salt and ghee; add rice flour; cover; rest 5 mins.
Knead warm dough smooth; make cups; fill; pleat and seal.
Steam 12–15 mins till shiny.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with ghee.
recipes.context_tips: Knead while warm; keep dough covered to prevent cracking.

recipes.title: Anarsa (Rice–Jaggery Fritters)
ingredients: Soaked rice (3 days) – 2 cups, dried and ground
procedure: Make dough by mixing rice flour with warm jaggery syrup; rest overnight.
Roll small discs; coat one side in poppy seeds; fry poppy side up till golden.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve in Diwali faral.
recipes.context_tips: Syrup should be soft-ball; too hard makes cracks.

recipes.title: Karanji (Coconut Hand Pie)
ingredients: Filling: Dry coconut – 1.5 cups; Sugar – 3/4 cup; Cardamom – 1/2 tsp; Poppy seeds – 2 tbsp
procedure: Knead stiff dough with moin; rest 20 mins.
Cook filling briefly to combine.
Roll discs; fill; crimp; fry on medium till crisp.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve in Diwali platters.
recipes.context_tips: Seal edges well to avoid leaks.

recipes.title: Rava Ladoo
procedure: Roast rava in ghee till fragrant; cool slightly; mix sugar and cardamom.
Sprinkle warm milk; bind laddoos.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve as faral sweet.
recipes.context_tips: Do not brown rava; aim for sandy texture.

recipes.title: Besan Ladoo
procedure: Roast besan in ghee on low till nutty and deep golden; cool; mix sugar and cardamom; shape laddoos.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve in festive boxes.
recipes.context_tips: Roast patiently; raw besan tastes chalky.

recipes.title: Ravali (Rice–Rava Cake)
procedure: Combine batters with jaggery and coconut; rest 20 mins.
Steam or bake till set.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve for Diwali/New Year.
recipes.context_tips: Do not overbake; should remain moist.

recipes.title: Tavali (Cucumber–Rice Sweet in Turmeric Leaves)
procedure: Mix all ingredients to thick batter; smear on turmeric leaves; fold; steam till set; unwrap to serve.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve warm with ghee.
recipes.context_tips: Turmeric leaves impart signature aroma; squeeze cucumber to avoid sogginess.

recipes.title: Aliv Ladoo (Garden Cress Seeds)
procedure: Melt jaggery; add soaked aliv and coconut; cook briefly; finish with ghee and cardamom; shape laddoos when warm.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve in winter; nourishing sweet.
recipes.context_tips: Do not overcook—seeds toughen.

recipes.title: Dashmi Bhaji (Ten-Vegetable Curry)
ingredients: Ten mixed veggies (gourd, beans, peas, brinjal, etc.) – 6–8 cups
1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera) or mustard seeds
300 gm potatoes, peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces
1/2 tsp dry mango powder (amchoor) or juice of 1/2 lemon
procedure: Grind coconut & spices; sauté onion; add vegetables; stir in masala; add water; simmer till tender; season.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with puri/bhakri.
recipes.context_tips: Cut veggies similar size for even cooking.

recipes.title: Vaala Che Mutke (Steamed Field-Bean Dumplings)
procedure: Mix all ingredients to thick batter; shape dumplings; steam till firm.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with chutney or ghee.
recipes.context_tips: Grease steamer plate to prevent sticking.

recipes.title: Birade (Kadve Vaal Curry for Ganesh)
procedure: Cook sprouts; make coconut masala; simmer together with goda masala, tamarind, jaggery; season.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve at Ganesh feasts with rice.
recipes.context_tips: Peeling skins gives classic mouthfeel.

recipes.title: Kombdi Vade (Chicken Curry with Rice Vade)
ingredients: Chicken curry – as per Kombdi Kalwan
Rice vade: Rice flour – 2 cups; Hot water – ~2 cups; Salt; Oil for fry
procedure: Make chicken curry (see Kombdi Kalwan).
For vade, make hot dough from scalded rice flour; knead; pat small discs; deep-fry till puffed and crisp.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve curry with hot vade, onion-lemon salad.
recipes.context_tips: Fry vade on medium heat to cook through without darkening.

recipes.title: Bhujing (Smoky Roasted Chicken with Poha)
ingredients: 2 medium potatoes, thickly sliced with skin
2 cups pressed rice (poha), washed and set aside
1 inch ginger, grated or made into a paste
4-5 cloves garlic, grated or made into a paste
procedure: Marinate the chicken: In a bowl, combine the chicken pieces and potato slices with the marinade ingredients (cumin powder, coriander powder, ¼ tsp turmeric, and salt). Mix well and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
Cook the chicken and potatoes.
Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a non-stick pan. Add the marinated chicken and potato mixture.
Cook on high heat for 5-6 minutes, then reduce the heat, cover, and cook for another 3-4 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender.
Smoke the chicken (Bhujing process):
Transfer the cooked chicken mixture to a larger bowl. Place the small steel bowl in the center. Heat a piece of charcoal on a direct flame until it is glowing red.
Carefully place the hot coal in the steel bowl, pour the ghee or oil over it, and immediately cover the large bowl with a lid to trap the smoke.
Let it sit for 2-3 minutes to infuse a smoky flavor.
Prepare the masala paste:
In a blender, combine the garlic, green chilies, ginger, grated coconut, red chili powder, and garam masala powder.
Blend to a coarse paste using a very small amount of water if needed.
Sauté the onions and masala:
In another non-stick pan, heat the remaining oil. Add the sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add the prepared coconut-spice paste and sauté until the oil separates from the masala.
Add the remaining turmeric powder and sauté for a few more seconds.
Combine and finish:
Add the smoked chicken mixture and the washed (pressed) rice (poha) to the pan.
Mix well to combine all the ingredients. Adjust salt if necessary and sprinkle some water to add moisture.
Cover and cook on low heat for 2-3 minutes.
Serve: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.title: Mutton Sukka (Dry Masala Goat)
ingredients: 500g Mutton (lamb or goat meat), cut into small pieces
1 Tbsp Tamarind pulp (mixed with a little water)
procedure: Marinate the mutton:
Wash and drain the mutton pieces. Marinate them for at least 30 minutes (or up to 1 hour) with turmeric powder, red chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, and salt.
Pressure cook the mutton:
In a pressure cooker, add the marinated mutton and about 1 cup of water. Cook for 4–5 whistles until the meat is tender. Keep the cooked mutton pieces and the cooking stock separate.
Prepare the masala powder:

In a dry pan, dry roast all the ingredients listed under 'Vadvali Masala' over low heat for 1–2 minutes until fragrant. Let the spices cool completely, then grind them into a fine powder using a blender or mixer.
Fry the mutton:
In a separate pan or wok (kadai), heat the oil. Add the sliced shallots, slit green chilies, and curry leaves.
Fry until the shallots are translucent and light brown at the edges.
Add flavor base:
Add the ginger-garlic paste and fry for another minute until the raw smell disappears.
Combine and cook:
Add the cooked mutton pieces and about half of the reserved stock water to the pan. Mix well and bring to a boil. Cook for about 10 minutes until the excess moisture starts to evaporate.
Finish the sukka:

Add the ground Vadvali masala powder and the tamarind pulp mixture. Mix thoroughly and continue to cook on low-medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the dish is dry and the spices coat the mutton pieces well.
Garnish and serve:
Check for seasoning and adjust salt if necessary. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.
recipes.serving_suggestions: Serve with vade/bhakri and lemon.
recipes.context_tips: Final roasting on low heat gives the signature sukka shine.
